definition: gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: The dean bridled with anger at my request.
sentences.chinese: 他对我提出的要求表示气愤。

sentences.english: I now feel  furious and want to do something.
sentences.chinese: 现在我觉得非常气愤，想做点什么。

sentences.english: He snorted indignantly and walked away.
sentences.chinese: 他气愤地哼了一声，走开了。

sentences.english: He was angry with the person who drove the car that hit his brother.
sentences.chinese: 他对那个开车撞死他哥哥的人很气愤。

sentences.english: He has noted that many women get irritated at being first-named .
sentences.chinese: 他已经注意到许多妇女对别人直呼其名很气愤。

sentences.english: And you thought the most enraging part of this was the inability to select a white model.
sentences.chinese: 而最让人气愤的或许是你还无法选择白色的机型。

sentences.english: Some body got angry about that because it was everybodys job.
sentences.chinese: 某个人对此感到非常气愤，因为这是大家的任务。

sentences.english: What annoyed me is not what you said but what you did .
sentences.chinese: 令我气愤的是你自食其言。

sentences.english: He had been arguing with the police,and was angry with them.
sentences.chinese: 他一直与警方争讼着，而且对警方十分气愤。

sentences.english: That was wrong! And you can tell by my tone of voice I mean she should feel it with some sense of gutsy indignation.
sentences.chinese: 你如果以我的口气这样说她，她也会感到十分气愤。

sentences.english: I guess they're mad about the perf. mp3ance of their baseball players.
sentences.chinese: 我猜他们是为了他们的棒球员表现而气愤不已。

sentences.english: However, the food options were outrageously expensive and the parking was a rip-off .
sentences.chinese: 但是实物价格高的让人气愤，停车场简直就是抢钱。

sentences.english: Hera, Zeus' wife, and also his sister, was very upset.
sentences.chinese: 赫拉，宙斯的妻子，也是他的姐姐，非常气愤。

sentences.english: Mr. Collins was also in the same state of angry pride.
sentences.chinese: 柯林斯先生也还是那样又气愤又傲慢的样子。

sentences.english: If I hold a grudge because I'm angry, I feel strong.
sentences.chinese: 如果我有怨恨，是因为我生气，我感觉很气愤。

sentences.english: Qu Yuan, see all of this, extreme anger.
sentences.chinese: 屈原看到这一切，极端气愤。

definition: variant of 憤憤不平|愤愤不平[fen4 fen4 bu4 ping2]
righteous indignation fills one's breast (idiom); to feel indignant at injustice
so angry it's unbearable/bitter about unbearable grievances
unable to restrain one's anger (idiom); in a towering rage
